title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II
description: You are given an integer array prices where prices[i] is the price of a given stock on the ith day. You want to maximize your profit by choosing a single day to buy one stock and choosing a different day in the future to sell that stock. However, you can buy and sell the stock multiple times (i.e., you can sell the stock and buy it again on different days). Note that you cannot engage in multiple transactions at the same time (i.e., you must sell the stock before you buy again). Return the maximum profit you can achieve.
input_format: An array of integers prices representing the stock prices.
output_format: An integer representing the maximum profit you can achieve.

examples.explanation: Buy on day 2 (price = 1) and sell on day 5 (price = 6), profit = 6 - 1 = 5. Then buy on day 4 (price = 3) and sell on day 5 (price = 4), profit = 4 - 3 = 1. Total profit = 5 + 1 = 6.
Buy on day 1 (price = 1) and sell on day 5 (price = 5), profit = 5 - 1 = 4.
There is no way to make a profit since prices are decreasing.

hints: Focus on the difference between consecutive prices.
Only add to profit when prices increase.
